results.title: Hillary ventures south
results.brief_description: A documentary chronicling a visit to Tasmania by Sir Edmund Hillary. He arrives, meets some dignitaries, surveys some national park areas to the south of Hobart, then joins a bushwalking club to scale Mount Mawson. The film focusses on what a thrill it is for these youngsters to climb alonside the man who scaled Everest. Hillary, the narrator tells us, says Tasmania has some of the greatest tramping country in the world.

results.title: Highfire: plan for survival
results.creator_credit: Bruce Kerner, William Brose and William Brose Productions
results.brief_description: Fire in high-rise buildings is a possibility that cannot be overlooked. This film is designed for all levels of employees and management in multi-storey buildings, and is a motivational film, demanding the viewer’s response to their own fire safety program.

results.title: High pressure drums
results.brief_description: A detailed account of the manufacture of high pressure boiler drums in one of Britain’s leading engineering works. Scenes of the installation of drums during the construction of a new atomic power plant show one of the many fields of industry in which this article is an essential component.

results.title: High Ground
results.brief_description: An historical overview of building development in the City of Melbourne culminating in the building of 101 Collins Street. Some fascinating archival footage is used to illustrate how the top end of Collins Street and the city in general developed as “the high ground”.

results.title: Herman holds a sales meeting
results.brief_description: A sales manager holds a sales meeting and explains his activities and operations. Flashbacks show what he really did and said. A light-hearted treatment which will counter-balance the serious side of any sales meeting.

results.title: Henry Ford 1863-1947
results.brief_description: Deals with the history and development of Henry Ford’s industrial empire. Archival film and re-enactments show events such as the building of the early car models, their effect on society, his relations with organised labour, and the impact of the Great Depression.
